subject: Transplants
Golf
Heart
lead_paragraph: Five months after receiving his second heart transplant, Erik Compton shot a four-under-par 68 on Friday at Crandon Golf Club in Key Biscayne, Fla., and advanced to the second stage of the PGA Tour’s qualifying tournament. Compton overcame a seven-shot deficit and turned in the best score of the day. He finished tied with six others for 23rd, taking the final qualifying spot. Compton’s next test will be a qualifying tournament in Pine Mountain, Ga. The final qualifying tournament is in Palm Springs, Calif., where 25 golfers will receive tour cards. ¶Seve Ballesteros had a third operation for a cancerous brain tumor, a six-and-a-half-hour procedure that went “better than expected.” Doctors removed the rest of the tumor and reduced brain swelling. Ballesteros, 51, was in stable condition in the intensive care unit at La Paz Hospital in Madrid. seve.
